results.title: Hong Kong: wandering with Rick
results.brief_description: With Rick we take a ferry-boat across Repulse Bay and catch a cable car up Victoria Peak for a panoramic view of Hong Kong. We ride a sampan from a fishing village, visit the busy docks of Hong Kong harbour and enjoy a rick-shaw ride through crowqded city streets.

results.title: Hong Kong: far eastern outpost of the empire
results.brief_description: Gives a brief history of the British colony, followed by scenes of the harbour with its houseboats and junks, the farmlands with traditional farming methods, shops and houses, and the streets full of people.

results.title: Hong Kong today
results.brief_description: Hong Kong was faced after the war with problems of over-crowding, unemployment, hardship and disease which to a less courageous and hard-working people might have proved insurmountable. The film surveys the industrial and commercial expansion, the building schemes, the education and health services, the modernisation of transport and the outstanding achievements in land reclamation, which are bringing prosperity to the people of Hong Kong.

results.title: Hong Kong movie man
results.brief_description: A skit on film making in Hong Kong. A look at the flourishing “string and rubber band” industry which has its comedy moments.

results.title: Hong Kong
results.brief_description: This is a British account of one of its colonies for over one hundred years. It describes the positive influences from Britain on the economy but also documents influences from China due to the large Chinese population, on culture and family. Also recognises China’s desire to regain Hong Kong.

results.title: Honeymation = Mezes-tangos
results.brief_description: Little honey cake figures are animated to lively Hungarian folk tunes. The simple animation techniques could be adapted for primary school use. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Honey, I shrunk the kids
results.creator_credit: Buena Vista Pictures, Penney Finkelman Cox and Joe Johnston
results.brief_description: A non-stop comedy adventure starring Rick Moranis as a preoccupied inventor who has created an electro-magnetic shrinking machine that is accidentally activated and shrinks his children to a minuscule size. After they are caught in the garbage and thrown outside, a visually innovative action packed adventure ensues as the children journey through their backyard and encounter attacking insects, a runaway lawnmower, and swooping bees along the way. A fun and heartwarming family film it is also preceded by a Roger Rabbit short adventure involving Baby Herman and a little medical mayhem in “Tummy Trouble”. Cast also includes Matt Frewer, Marcia Strassman, Kristine Sutherland, Thomas Brown, Jared Rushton.

results.title: Honey harvest
results.creator_credit: Western Australian Government Film Unit, Department of Agriculture Western Australia and Norman A. Uren
results.brief_description: Shows the gathering of honey from wildflowers. It is a seasonal activity and beekeepers move the hives to follow the honey flow throughout the state. The film depicts the extraction of honey, packing and bulk handling. Honey is loaded at Fremantle and shipped overseas. Commercial uses of honey are also indicated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Western Australian Government Film Unit, Department of Agriculture Western Australia and Norman A. Uren

results.title: Honey bees and pollination
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, J.V. Durden, Larry Gosnell and David Bairstow
results.brief_description: A color film showing the relationship between the activity of bees and the fertility of field and orchard crops. Much of the film is in close-up so that the process of cross-pollination of flowers by bees can be clearly observed. The life of the hive is similarly illustrated, including the peculiar dance by which a successful bee tells the others where its source of honey is located. The film warns that indiscriminate use of chemical sprays may destroy bees, with consequent loss of fertility in crops.

results.title: Honey bee
results.brief_description: A study of the domestic bee, including the function in the hive of the workers, the drones, and the queen; the egg, larvae, and cocoon stages of the workers; the metamorphosis of the queen; the swarming of the hive; building a new cone; and honey-making are all dealt with in detail.
results.description: A study of the domestic bee, including the function in the hive of the workers, the drones, and the queen; the egg, larvae, and cocoon stages of the workers; the metamorphosis of the queen; the swarming of the hive; building a new cone; and honey-making are all dealt with in detail.
